intro: Lychnis sylvestris var. carnea, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Lychnis sylvestris var. carnea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
